text:
#AdventOfCode Day 24: "Never Tell Me The Odds"

https://t.co/CcfpFjmFPB

I get a bunch of 3d coordinates and velocities for hailstones, and have to find how they interact. sympy saves part 2.

description.string_value: For Advent of Code 2023 Day 24, I get initial x, y, z positions and velocities for 300 hailstones. In part 1, I need to find how many of them cross in the X-...

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 23: "Long Walk"

https://t.co/SJl8MZbizB

I'm asked to find the longest path through a maze. I'll reduce the problem to make it solvable.

description.string_value: For Advent of Code 2023 Day 23, I get a grid with paths through a forest. I'm asked to find the longest path possible. I'll reduce the problem by getting a l...

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 22: "Sand Slabs"

https://t.co/44i25Ykmu8

Each of 1500 lines has two x,y,z coordinates for a block falling through space. I have to let them all fall, and the figure out how others fall when blocks are removed.

description.string_value: For Advent of Code 2023 Day 22, I get a bunch of blocks, each represented by two x, y, z coordinates. I start by letting the blocks all fall down until they ...

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 21: "Step Counter"

https://t.co/CwtM4D9Sfd

I have to take a given number of steps around a grid and count spots where I could end. In part two, it's 26 million steps on an infinitely repeating grid. Very tricky, but fun challenge.

description.string_value: For Advent of Code 2023 Day 21, I'm given a grid of spaces and rocks, and asked to find how many spaces an elf could stop in after exactly 64 steps. I'll sol...

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 20: "Pulse Propagation"

https://t.co/XKoSw32vHU

I'll propagate a series of high and low pulses through a series of modules, counting and looking for cycles.

description.string_value: For Advent of Code 2023 Day 20, I get a list of modules that propagate pulses either as high or low and change state based on what they receive. I'll use a q...

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 19: "Aplenty"

https://t.co/MgKwDfgMKF

Very challenging yet fun. Part 1 is mostly text parsing, but part two I'll have to work a ranges through a workflow, cutting them into parts and processing them all. Recursion is key!

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 18: "Lavaduct Lagoon"

https://t.co/xnktvJKyHd

I get instructions to draw out the outline of a polygon, and then need to count the spaces inside and the border. I'll use Shoelace formula and Pick's Theorem.

description.string_value: For Advent of Code 2023 Day 18, I get a series of instructions for moving around a grid digging out a polygon trench. In each part, I need to find the total ...

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 17: "Clumsy Crucible"

https://t.co/NxpxblAFQN

I'll move through a grid looking for the least expensive path. I'll use a heapq to do something Dijkstra-esque.

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 16: "The Floor Will Be Lava"

https://t.co/2rXn8xi3dV

I get a grid of angled and splitting mirrors and need to bound beams through it and track what spaces are visited.

https://t.co/Rzr3KLuMJN

I get to make a custom really bad hash function and then track lens through a series of boxes. Much easier than yesterday!

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 14: "Parabolic Reflector Dish"

https://t.co/2sGrsaFZB9

Rolling rocks around a grid by tilting it in different directions. Really hard challenge, but some fun comes from it.

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 13: "Point of Incidence"

https://t.co/nP622GbUCN

It's all about finding a mirror line in a grid. In part 2, I need to find the mirror line where there's one mistake across the mirror.

text:
#AdventOfCode Day 11: "Cosmic Expansion"

https://t.co/J7xDbmr0kI

I get a grid with galaxies, and I need to calculate the distance between them. The twist is that empty rows and columns count for more space.
